Key Match Events: Luka Doncic led all players with 37 points and nine assists
John Collins led the Jazz with 28 points and nine rebounds
Dallas lost their fourth straight game, all in the clutch
The Jazz's first home win of the season
Dallas' 30.8% free-throw shooting was a concern
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Kidd decided to really shake up the starting lineup, rolling with Luka Doncic, Quentin Grimes, Klay Thompson, Maxi Kleber, and Dereck Lively II
Dallas had to do it without Kyrie Irving, who was a late scratch with a shoulder sprain
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic led all players with 37 points and nine assists, but he also turned it over three times
The Mavericks have a lot of issues to fix; some of them could be fixed by getting healthy, but oftentimes, they're just not showing energy
Dallas just wasn't good enough defensively, especially in the third quarter, against a team that was dead last in offense entering the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks return home to play the San Antonio Spurs on Saturday
Dallas allowed 16 offensive rebounds, turned it over 17 times, and shot just 30.8% from the free-throw line
The Mavericks were hesitant to shoot, lacking energy, and in their own heads as they faced a 99-85 deficit heading into the fourth quarter
